BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER

SUMMARY

Experienced sales professional and effective leader.
Currently a sales professional for CT of Wolters Kluwer.
Highly motivated, self — driven , result-oriented consultant
Tenacious new business prospecting, selling, negotiating and closing skills
Skillful verbal and written communication skills including the ability to present to an executive-level
audience
Passion for gaining personal relationships with clients
Strong understanding and use of strategic selling techniques
Former professional athlete

03/2017 to Current
Business Development Manager

value delivered by solutions in order to ensure success with key initiatives

Accountable for the entire sales cycle from prospecting to closing deals, forecasting, and strategic planning
July 2015 - March 2017 - Business Development Manager
Wolters Kluwer/CT Corporation

customers of representation and compliance services, formation/qualification services, and other on demand services
Leverage strategic planning in order to optimize revenue generation of sales efforts
Participate in collecting and evaluating performance metrics by participating in in-depth and on-going analysis of
departmental services, processes, and customer preferences; understanding the overall needs of the law firm channels
and what factors contribute to success; assist with monitoring department metrics; assisting in the identification of
relationships and trends in the data as well as factors influencing results; contributing to the development of solutions to
maintain or improve customer satisfaction, increase revenue and/or decrease expenses. May 2012 - July 2015 - Tampa & Southwest Florida Territory Manager
LexisNexis

Qualified and earned a Top Performer's Trip (2012 and 2014). Created and implemented effective account/territory plans that included; developing and implementing a sales strategy
considering new business growth, managing all resources necessary to drive new business; forecasting revenue;
developing key contacts and business relationships within a new account including influential individual and high level
decision makers.
Identified and qualified opportunities in order to successfully advance them through selling process to close.
Consistently identified and communicated effectively with executives or other high level officials to articulate competitive
differentiators and provide a solution-based sales presentation. Established and maintained excellent customer relationships at all levels, and acted as a liaison between sales support
and our customers to ensure a positive onboarding process. Developed strategic sales plans using business analysis tools to identify and track revenue trends, recognize sales
opportunities, target specific sales activities, and analyze competitive threats within my territory. January 2010 - April 2012 - Michigan & South Dakota Account Executive (Dayton, Ohio)
LexisNexis

considering new business growth, managing all resources necessary to drive new business; forecasting revenue;
developing key contacts and business relationships within a new account including influential individual and high level
decision makers.
Identified and qualified opportunities in order to successfully advance them through selling process to close.
Established and maintained excellent customer relationships at all levels, and acted as a liaison between sales support
and our customers to ensure a positive onboarding process.
Customized pricing proposals that matched the LexisNexis solutions to the prospective customer's business needs.
Developed strategic sales plans using business analysis tools to identify and track revenue trends, recognize sales
opportunities, target specific sales activities, and analyze competitive threats within my territory.

02/1998 to 12/2009

Manage the activities of 150 coaches, trainers and team managers.
Team leader for presentations delivered one-on-one and in both small and large group settings.
Taught thirty certified license courses graduating over 1000 professional coaches.
Successfully achieved day to day operational goals while focusing on long term strategic goals.

Responsible for developing, reviewing, and updating all training and educational materials.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Business Developer

Location: Philadelphia, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Marketing, Sales

Description:
Business Developer
REMOTE POSITION: MUST BE ELIGIBLE TO WORK IN THE USEvent and training company supporting Life Science industries is in search of a trade experienced business development professional.
 RESPONSIBILITIES:Business Development:* Develop new sales opportunities by executing sales strategies targeting new accounts fitting the Company Model.* Establish rapport to take a consultative approach to solving client problems. Earn prospect trust to learn their needs and provide a Company solution roadmap.* Present and demonstrate the value of Company solutions to qualified prospective clients; always positioning to close business.* Produce optimal proposal materials to clearly define the company’s value proposition as an impetus to contract new business.* Implement Business Plans to increase sales volume, and market share, expand relationships, and create referral opportunities.* Always contribute market insight for improved and expanded Company offerings.Execution and Revenue Generation:* Seek out, build, and maintain a targeted prospect list to pursue.* Meet and exceed Company sales objectives by adopting the Company methodology, including KPI adherence, exceeding activity targets.* Employ CRM for prospect development, activities tracking, forecasting, reporting, and accountability.* Prepare and negotiate agreements to optimize selling Gross Margins in consultation with the team.Post-Sale Responsibilities:* Work with Processing, Finance, Education & Training teams to transition new clients to the company process.* Collaborate with internal staff to resolve any issues related to implementation or support,* Leverage key accounts or partner relationships for additional sales and referrals.* Perform impactful Quarterly Business Reviews (QBR) with key clients to ensure satisfaction and uncover additional opportunities.* Provide feedback to Senior Management regarding ways to decrease the sales cycle, enhance sales, and/or improve the Company’s brand and reputation.* Provide ongoing market perspective by monitoring competitors, attending conferences (e.g., LTEN), and participating in campaigns.* Represent Company professionally and effectively and function as an ambassador for the brand at all times including conferences, professional organizations, and networking events as well as all internal interactions.REQUIREMENTS:* Bachelor’s degree in Sales, Communication or Business or related field* 3-5 years’ proven successful sales experience in Life Sciences industry.* Comprehensive and current knowledge of industry offerings and trends* Outstanding knowledge of MS Office; knowledge of CRM software* Soft skills: Motivated, skilled influencer and negotiator; excellent interpersonal skills, strong communication skills, ability to effectively lead and interact with multiple disciplines/departments; solid relationship-building skills; superior customer service skills.

Experience Level (if available): Director
<JD_END>
